page.title: 11MOLEWOOD
page.content: To the East of Waterford Marsh lies Great Molewood. This is a popular walking area for people living in the Molewood Estate. The wood contains an interesting collection of flora and fauna. Over two dozen species of bird have been observed here. Muntjac deer are quite common. On the northern edge of the wood the Redland Gravel Company has greatly increased its gravel extraction during the last two or three years. Two years ago local residents successfully opposed an application for planning permission to build houses on the site of the disused gravel pit behind Cowper Crescent. Great Molewood seems to be under threat.
